title: Husband who left dying wife in soiled chair 'drowned her screams out with TV'
text:

A 'disgraceful' husband who left his ill wife in such horrifically squalid conditions it led to her death would turn up the TV volume to drown out her screams, according to a neighbour.

Richard Wallach left Valerie in her armchair, where she was found infested with flies and maggots and riddled with painful skin ulcers, at their hell hole home in Toxteth, Liverpool.

A neighbour told the Liverpool Echo he "always had his TV on blasting or his music to drown out his wife's screams."

Shocked emergency workers described the 62-year-old woman as in "the worst condition of a living human they had ever seen".

Valerie, who had cancer , was left to sit and ultimately die in a urine and faeces-soiled armchair and was so poorly she had lost the ability to speak.

(Image: merpol)

She died from breast cancer and multi-organ failure 19 days after being rescued in August, 2017.

Earlier this month, 66-year-old Wallach was jailed for eight years after a jury found him guilty of manslaughter by gross negligence at Liverpool Crown Court.

When informed by stunned medics that his 'babbling' wife would likely die that day, Wallach replied: "Thanks for letting me know, but who is going to sort out my problem?

"I have been constipated for weeks."

Now, the Liverpool Echo can reveal how disgusted neighbours were repulsed by his behaviour.

One neighbour, who did not wish to be named, said: "I lived next door for nine years, and he was a nasty piece of work, in fact one of the most arrogant people I've ever come across in my life.

"He was banging on my walls all hours of the night terrorising my children so they had to sleep in bed with me.

"Him and his wife used to give each other hell, arguing constantly day and night so much I had to keep my windows closed.

"He was very nasty with a very bad attitude, he didn't want anyone moving in next to him.

"He would let his wife scream 'help me, help me' for hours on end, it wasn't an unusual occurrence.

"All she did, day in day out, was scream, 'help me, I can't move, help me, help me.'

"And he would just ignore her.

"The man is vile and deserves to be locked up - he didn't even care yet he looked after himself."

(Image: liverpoolecho.co.uk)

(Image: liverpoolecho.co.uk)

Wallach, who is hard of hearing, kept his own bedroom clean and tidy, along with a 'smoking room' where he would relax away from his sick wife.

Emergency services who attended the address wore protective clothing because it was so filthy, with bags of rubbish with rotting and mouldy food.

Valerie's health was so grave that she was found babbling by paramedics and firefighters.

The ulcers to her buttocks, backs of thighs and both heels were categorised as 'Grade 4' pressure sores, said to be 'of the worst kind', which revealed deep tissue damage extending down to the bone.

Skin was left behind on the armchair when Valerie was eased up, with a foul smell coming from the leaking ulcers.

Piles of papers, Pot Noodle packaging and filled bin bags covered every surface surrounding the brown leather Chesterfield chair.

(Image: liverpoolecho.co.uk)

The neighbour added: "Her screams became a lot more frequent last few months and my children started to get scared towards the end.

"He was a horrible neighbour, always had his TV on blasting or his music to drown out his wife's screams.

"I'm really not surprised he did what he did because from the arguments I heard he was selfish, manipulative, and nasty with a vile attitude.

"He's a disgrace."

(Image: liverpoolecho.co.uk)

When the bereavement officer at the Royal Liverpool Hospital offered to pay for a basic funeral package for his wife, Wallach 'became agitated that it did not include the provision of a car for him.'

Valerie, who was covered in brown slime when she was rushed to hospital, ultimately died from breast cancer and multi-organ failure.

Last week, a judge branded remorseless Wallach "thoroughly selfish" at the end of his trial.

The Wallachs were married for 15 years and had moved to Liverpool in 2003, having no visitors to the house, and no relatives other than their two children.
description: Richard Wallach was jailed for eight years after a jury found him guilty of manslaughter by gross negligence at Liverpool Crown Court
